intro: Phyllanthus koumacensis var. koumacensis, commonly known as the Koumacensis Phyllanthus, is a flowering plant native to Madagascar. It belongs to the Euphorbiaceae family and is characterized by its small, clustered leaves and inconspicuous flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments within the rainforests of Madagascar. Its botanical features include smooth, dark green foliage and a compact growth habit. Due to its limited distribution and unique morphology, it is of interest to botanists and conservationists.
